lines.text: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Where is the fellow

lines.speaker: alexas
lines.text: Half afeard to come.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Go to, go to. Come hither, sir.
Enter the Messenger as before

lines.speaker: alexas
lines.text: Good majesty, Herod of Jewry dare not look upon you But when you are well pleased.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: That Herods head Ill have: but how, when Antony is gone Through whom I might command it Come thou near.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Most gracious majesty,

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Didst thou behold Octavia

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Ay, dread queen.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Where

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Madam, in Rome I lookd her in the face, and saw her led Between her brother and Mark Antony.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Is she as tall as me

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: She is not, madam.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Didst hear her speak is she shrilltongued or low

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Madam, I heard her speak she is lowvoiced.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Thats not so good: he cannot like her long.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Like her! O Isis! tis impossible.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: I think so, Charmian: dull of tongue, and dwarfish! What majesty is in her gait Remember, If eer thou lookdst on majesty.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: She creeps: Her motion and her station are as one She shows a body rather than a life, A statue than a breather.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Is this certain

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Or I have no observance.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Three in Egypt Cannot make better note.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Hes very knowing I do perceivet: theres nothing in her yet: The fellow has good judgment.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Guess at her years, I prithee.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Madam, She was a widow,

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Widow! Charmian, hark.

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: And I do think shes thirty.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Bearst thou her face in mind ist long or round

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Round even to faultiness.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: For the most part, too, they are foolish that are so. Her hair, what colour

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Brown, madam: and her forehead As low as she would wish it.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Theres gold for thee. Thou must not take my former sharpness ill: I will employ thee back again I find thee Most fit for business: go make thee ready Our letters are prepared.
Exit Messenger

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: A proper man.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Indeed, he is so: I repent me much That so I harried him. Why, methinks, by him, This creatures no such thing.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Nothing, madam.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: Hath he seen majesty Isis else defend, And serving you so long!

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian: But tis no matter thou shalt bring him to me Where I will write. All may be well enough.

lines.speaker: charmian
lines.text: I warrant you, madam.
Exeunt
